front.title: Radius Security Extensions using Kerberos v5

abstract.t: The RADIUS protocol described in RFC2865 and RFC2866 defines hop by hop message integrity and minimal AVP encryption using statically configured symmetric transforms to secure communication between two adjacent RADIUS peers. Cross domain Radius applications like roaming have a requirement for end to end security. This document specifies how end to end AVP authentication, integrity and encryption can be provided for RADIUS using the Kerberos protocol. This document also specifies how additionally stronger hop by hop AVP authentication, integrity and encryption can be provided for RADIUS using the Kerberos protocol.
